smell_analysis.justification: All provided diagrams (pages 1-19) contain visible content and elements; none are empty.

All use cases in the diagrams (Pages 2 and 3) are associated with an actor, either directly or indirectly via «include» relationships (e.g., 'Lisa auto' is included by 'Registreeri auto', which connects to 'Autode haldur').

No distinct use cases connected to the same actor describe the exact same activity. While 'Registreeri auto' and 'Lisa auto' are similar, 'Lisa auto' is modeled as an included sub-process, distinct from the main trigger.
No duplicate element names were found within the same package scope on the Package Diagram (Page 1).
No redundant data value storage (denormalization) was found. Repeated columns like 'reg_aeg' are standard audit fields, and relationships use proper Foreign Keys (e.g., 'riik_kood' in 'Isik').
Use case naming is consistent, using the imperative verb form (e.g., 'Vaata...', 'Tuvasta...', 'Registreeri...', 'Muuda...').
In the State Diagram (Page 9), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, etc.) are reachable via transitions starting from the initial state 'Alg'.
In the Activity Diagram (Page 4), all actions are reachable through the decision flows originating from the start node.

All class and data model relationships display necessary multiplicity (e.g., '0..*' to '1'). Association classes (e.g., Page 12 'Auto_kategooria_omamine') correctly use dashed lines where multiplicity is implied by the link itself.
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements. The largest data models (Page 15) contain 9 tables, and the activity diagram (Page 4) contains fewer than 10 actions.
No class or table has 6 or more visual connections on a single page. The most connected elements (e.g., 'Isik' on Page 6) have 5 connections.
The layout of elements is balanced. While some transitions in the State Diagram (Page 9) are long, they do not exceed twice the average distance in a way that indicates poor layout.
All use cases and activity actions start with an active verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali', 'Lõpeta').
No element names are too short (3 or fewer characters). The shortest identifiers are 'Riik', 'Isik', 'Auto' (4 characters).
Class names are consistently Singular and Capitalized (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Tootaja').
Attribute and column names consistently start with lowercase letters (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'reg_aeg').

No Hungarian notation or type prefixes (e.g., 'tbl_', 'str') were found. Prefixes like 'PK_', 'FK_', and 'AK_' (Alternate Key) found in the data models are allowed or standard database metadata indicators.
